name: St. Nicholas Owen

locations.description: Master builder of priest holes, martyred in London, England

summary: Nicholas Owen was an English Catholic layman and martyr known as 'Little John.' He was a master carpenter who built ingenious hiding places (priest holes) in Catholic homes to protect priests from discovery. Despite being physically disabled, he worked tirelessly to protect the Catholic clergy. He was arrested, tortured in the Tower of London, and died under torture. He is one of the Forty Martyrs of England and Wales and is the patron saint of illusionists and escape artists.
